text: So with content staging, duplicate the page on the content staging server, make the changes, then swap?
Same here. A horizontal spacer was also shown if I'm correct. Not necessary imho.

<@U2H3TT8F2> Thanks so much for the feedback on this. Do you have an example of the template code that is generating the uneditable module in question? Clare is correct that we did decide to make those visible in response to user feedback, but it sounds like we should find a way to avoid those gross strings from showing as the name in the sidebar.

<@UDP810G8L> Can you tell me a little bit more about this? We're having a big discussion about this specific question, so I'm curious what you're hoping to accomplish with this being available for custom modules.

Specifically, beyond just being able to adjust those things, I'm curious as to how that would be beneficial in your case. And anyone else who may also be on this thread, for that matter. :slightly_smiling_face:
Yeah sorta. HubSpot does all of the hard stuff. You just push buttons.
Make sure if you are doing template level changes to clone your template ands use the new one for your changes.
btw it was a template level change which is why I was asking. so jsut to be clear: clone template & edit, clone page and apply newly edited template, edit page content to liking, swap with old page
